c74object.name: bach.ratnum
c74object.description: Displays, inputs, and outputs rational numbers.

outlet.digest: Send a bang when the Tab key has been pressed

method.name: (mouse)
method.description: Clicking and dragging up and down on the numerator or denominator (when the patcher window is locked) moves the displayed value up and down, and outputs new values continuously. Numerator and denominator can be clicked and dragged individually. If the autoreduce attribute is active, the output result is always reduced to the lowest terms, even if, for interface clarity, the displayed number is not, until the mouse has been released. When the active patcher window is locked, numbers can be entered into bach.ratnum directly by clicking on it with the mouse and typing in a number on the computer keyboard. Typing the Return or Enter keys on Macintosh or the Enter key on windows, or clicking outside the box, sends the number out the outlet.

method.name: bang
method.description: Sends the currently displayed rational number out the left outlet.

method.name: llll
method.description: The number received in the inlet is stored, displayed, and sent through the left outlet. Floating point numbers are approximated and converted into rational numbers. Integer numbers are displayed as rational number with denominator 1.

method.name: max
method.description:
Syntax: max <llll: value>
The word min, followed by a number (of any type), sets the maximum value that can be displayed or sent out. The word max followed by the symbol none removes any prior maximum value constraint.

method.name: min
method.description:
Syntax: min <llll: value>
The word min, followed by a number (of any type), sets the minimum value that can be displayed or sent out. The word min followed by the symbol none removes any prior minimum value constraint.

method.name: reduce
method.description: Explicitely reduces the rational number to lowest terms. This operation is always performed automatically, unless the autoreduce attribute is deactivated (in which case it is only performed for incoming numbers, but not for the one typed in or changed via the interface).

method.name: set
method.digest: Set the value with no output
method.description:
Syntax: set <number/anything/llll: value>
The word set, followed by a rational number, sets the stored and displayed value to that number without triggering the output.

attribute.name: autoreduce
attribute.description: If this flag is set to 1, rationals typed in or changed via mousedrag are automatically reduced to lowest terms before being output, each time the mouse is released. If this flag is set to 0, this does not happens, and one should send explicitely a reduce message. This distinction only applies for numbers introduced or changed via the interface: ANY rational number introduced via message is automatically reduced to lowest terms.

attribute.name: bgcolor
attribute.description: Sets the color for the displayed/unclicked background.

attribute.name: bordercolor
attribute.description: Sets the color for the object's outline.

attribute.name: htricolor
attribute.description: Sets the highlight color for the triangle that indicates that the contents are editable. This is used when the content is being edited.

attribute.name: maximum
attribute.description: Sets the maximum value that can be displayed or sent out.

attribute.name: minimum
attribute.description: Sets the minimum value that can be displayed or sent out.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, except for the size limitation), some specific kinds of symbols are preceded by a backtick: namely, symbols containing parens, or containing textual representations of numbers or pitches, or beginning with a backtick, plus the symbols "null" and "nil" (distinct from the reserved words "null" and "nil" representing the empty list and the empty sublist) are preceded by a backtick. Moreover, the symbols "int", "float" or "list" are preceded by a backtick only if they are the first element of an llll, to distinguish them from the corresponding reserved messages of Max.
m: 'max' output: mostly equivalent to the "t" specifier, but no symbol is backticket except "int", "float" and "list" at the beginning of an llll. It is important to notice that, differently from text-format lllls proper, Max-format lllls might not be invertible even if they do not reach the size limit for Max message. This means that a bach object receiving a Max-format llll output from another bach object might interpret it differently from the original, or in some cases might even reject it.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

attribute.name: outputmode
attribute.description: Sets the output mode: if this is "Rational" (default), a single rational is output. If this is "List", numerator and denominator are output separately in a list (plain llll, containing just the two values).

attribute.name: textcolor
attribute.description: Sets the color for the displayed/unclicked number values.

attribute.name: triangle
attribute.description: Toggles the drawing of a triangular arrow pointing to the number in the number box. The default is 1 (draw the triangle)

attribute.name: tricolor
attribute.description: Sets the color for the triangle that indicates that the contents are editable. This is used when the content is not being edited.

attribute.name: triscale
attribute.description: Scales the size of the triangle drawn in the number box.

c74object.discussion: Since rational numbers are not a Max default supported type, the output is by default an llll containing the rational number.
